definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: Ivan was surprised. He asked again to make sure that she accepted his love.
sentences.chinese: 依凡呆住了，他又问了一遍来确定她已接受了他的爱。

sentences.english: When I saw Yeti on Himalayas, I was so surprised I stopped dead .
sentences.chinese: 我在喜马拉雅山遇到雪人时，我吃惊得呆住了。

sentences.english: He just froze and stared at me for two or three minutes.
sentences.chinese: 他呆住了，眼睛盯着我看了二三分钟。

sentences.english: When I found that the ring you left on my table, I was shocked.
sentences.chinese: 当我发现你留在我桌子上的戒指，我完全呆住了。

sentences.english: Louis and I were speechless, paralyzed.
sentences.chinese: 路易斯和我都哑口无言，呆住了。

sentences.english: But he stopped abruptly at the sight of their faces .
sentences.chinese: 但是他看到他们的脸就呆住了。

sentences.english: When her father heard the news, he went numb.
sentences.chinese: 当她的爸爸听到这个消息后，他呆住了。

sentences.english: He suddenly sees Ilsa beside, stupefied.
sentences.chinese: 他突然看到一旁的伊尔莎，呆住了。

sentences.english: They were horrified by the outrage before their eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他们被亲眼所见的暴行吓得呆住了。

definition: lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
agape and tongue-tied (idiom); at a loss for words/gaping and speechless
to look at each other in dismay (idiom)
